pageContext.claim: “He [the governor of Nevada] doesn't even wanna have a guaranteed signature on. In other words, he doesn't even wanna have a notarized or otherwise guaranteed signature. What kind of a vote is that? It's a very serious problem. And he's the leader in the whole country of doing it deceptively and dangerously. And it's a danger for our democracy.”
pageContext.analysis: This is totally false. No election officials, Democrat or Republican, were trying to end signature verification measures for mail ballots. In fact, more states had adopted signature verification and other safety measures for the 2020 election.
